questions.question_text:
A company configures external access for suppliers in the Microsoft Teams admin center.
Users can chat only with external users from VendorA.
You need to ensure that users can chat externally with users from VendorB.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE:
Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Correct
C and D. Presuming both tenants are configured as closed federation.

Selected Answer: CD
For a closed federation between the company and its vendor A both sides need to make sure they have their domains within the Allowed domains list.

choices.C: Add the VendorB domain to the federation Allowed Domains list.
choices.B: Modify the CNAME for SIP federation.
choices.D: Ask the VendorB tenant to add your domain to their Allowed Domains list.
choices.A: Add the VendorB domain as a remote domain to the Connectors list.

HOTSPOT -
You manage the Microsoft Teams environment for a company. A user tries to sign in to the Teams web client. The following error message displays:
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that answers each question based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct Answers are: 
1. Conditional Access Policy
2. Azure Active Directory
3. Advise user to sign in by using the desktop app.

MS 740 Microsoft Training - Check out the video at the bottom of the page. The policy only blocks Teams Web App and not the desktop client. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/troubleshoot-issues-signing-into-microsoft-teams/3-review-configure-conditional-access?ns-enrollment-type=LearningPath&ns-enrollment-id=learn.wwl.troubleshoot-microsoft-365-teams

Correct Answers are:
1. Conditional Access Policy
2. Azure Active Directory
3. Advise user to sign in by using the desktop app.
Or it can be "Advice user to enroll the device with Microsoft Intune"
The answer should be "Advice user to sign in by using the desktop app", as the error says it can be accessed through Desktop client

Which action should you perform so that the user can sign in?

The answer could either be - "Advice user to sign in by using the desktop app" or Advice user to enroll the device with Microsoft Intune. The question isn't clear to help us identify which could be the best answer.

comments.content: I think it's easier to use a desktop app than to enroll the devise with Intune, and the message also says "...or client applications"
keep in mind, user would not know how to enroll in Intune on its own. :)

I would go for "advice user to enrolle the device with Microsoft Intune" because in the message it says "devices or client applications that meet Contoso Management Compliance Policy"
For me this is a hint that it has to be an intune enrolled device.
